text: finally got a chance to sit down with this. I think overall it’s pretty great considering what we asked for. If it were up to me, I’d probably strike the conference room right next to the open space - just to open things up a little - but other than that, I like it

agreed. I think getting rid of that room opens up the option to create a more modular and open social/eating space, and potentially have an eating area that’s a bit more permanent. I really don’t want to sacrifice awesome cafe seating for necessarily modular/moveable event seating...
i love the sliding projector screen that hides the bikes
Also, does anyone else think the kitchen location is a bit awkward.
with lots of different away-from-desk working spaces peppered all over the office, could be cool to play with sensors to detect occupancy so that I can see what rooms are available?
yeah the kitchen does seem a bit weird
and i also think we’re missing some reception seating, though we could use the socialspace/casual seating area for that
do we know what size these desks are?
personally - I really like the location of the kitchen, but that’s just me. as for the desks, I believe they’re roughly the size of the standing desks in the design room
i don’t mind the location, i just feel bad for the “receptionista” who is going to have tons of food smells and people walking by them all the time
oh the plus side - they wont get lonely

Re: kitchen location, I’m thinking of  the following scenario that I think would occur multiple times on a daily basis: Folks squeezing behind the Receptionista™ with various foods and drinks on their way to their desks or seating areas. That would also interrupt the flow from the entrance to the desks area.
i think we could move the reception area up, and put a wall behind, even with enough roomf or sitback space that could buy us some counterspace?
also, people coming into the office and seeing a bunch of Kitchen Stuff, which despite our best intentions, will likely not always look client-ready
i guess thats where the “sliding panel with graphic” comes in?
but yeah i mostly just worry about flow into and out of the kitchen
Right, also thinking about people trying to talk to the Receptionista™ with the sound of the coffee grinder in the background.
like, could we bump the “small meeting / tiny booth” back to the wall/windows, creating a wider passage between desk area / social space? that might help with traffic
i dunno
ugh we have so many opinions
yeah - I could see losing that tiny booth
I think we’ll probably want that extra conference room though
especially if we lose the conf room on the outer wall
yeah i’m not sayiing lose them, i’m just saying push them back against the wall/window
right now there are narrow passageways on either side of those
ah
right - I could be wrong, but i think thats an artifact of a desire to have the “work” part of the office easily lockable for public events
which isn’t to say there aren’t other options, but I suspect that’s where that came from
ah right right
one wide sliding panel instead of two narrow ones?
seems possible
The sliding panel on the other side is kind of strange. Our visitors won’t be able to go to the bathroom during events?
NO!
screw them
they want our food AND our bathrooms!?
you’re right. idk what I was thinking
there's a roof deck, they can just go up there to pee
